info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of western Prowers, Baca, east central Las Animas and southern Bent Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong winds that will affect portions of Prowers, Baca, Las Animas, and Bent Counties through 245PM CDT. Occasional showers and thunderstorms, along with blowing dust reducing visibilities to below 1 mile, could accompany this activity. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Prowers, Baca, east central Las Animas and southern Bent Counties, including the following locations... Caddoa. The strong winds will eventually impact the Highway 287 corridor across southeast Colorado after 230PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds and blowing dust may occur without any lightning or rain.
